org.jcouchdb.document
Class Attachment

java.lang.Object
  org.jcouchdb.document.Attachment

public class Attachment
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a couchdb document attachment. The attachment mechanism mirrors the functionality present in couchdb itself. You will only be able to indirectly use the data property contained in Attachment to create attachments inlined with the document. When you query a document with attachments, the attachments will have a null data property and the stub property will be set to true. This limitation has its origin in the way couchdb works and is deliberately kept that way to not introduce additional queries.

Author:
shelmberger

getData

public java.lang.String getData()
Returns the Base64 encoded representation of this attachment's content. note that you cannot read attachment data this way. the property is only used internally to create inlined attachments and is set to null when reading documents. This limitation has its origin in the way couchdb works and is deliberately kept that way to not introduce additional queries.

Returns:

setData

public void setData(java.lang.String data)
